Families of loved ones trapped in the besieged port city demonstrated in Kyiv, as conditions for the 3,000 people still holed up at the plant are extremely dire. We don't live, we survive, says Natalia, the wife of a soldier in Mariupol.

sentences.sentence: We can't sleep, we can't even eat a piece of bread because our husbands are starving.

sentences.sentence: In the town of Assisi, Italy,

sentences.sentence: people gather for the traditional May the 1st Labor Day parades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Along with the usual statements on the importance of work and of strong labor protections, this year many are talking and thinking about the plight of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: To work for peace is one of the day's slogans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And in Marseille, it's much the same picture.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In the wake of French President Emmanuel Macron's re-election and with not long till the legislative elections here, people are mobilising. This sign is protesting against Macron's proposed increase of the retirement age, for example.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And in Moscow, a workers' day parade with a different perspective. People who are supporting Russia's invasion of Ukraine have finished a cross-country trip in Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Here, they laid flowers at a memorial dedicated to the Soviet victory in World War II.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: For the first time since the start of the pandemic over two years ago,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Italians can once again enter bars, supermarkets, restaurants, shops and most workplaces without having to wear a mask.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The need to show the vaccine or so-called green pass will also be phased out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This follows the government's decision to ease some of the measures to prevent COVID-19 infection.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This decision was needed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We've waited more than two years, but maybe we're finally getting out of this situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: However, face masks remain mandatory on all public transport, in hospitals, cinemas and in schools for students over six years of age. And not everyone is happy to go mask-free.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We are happy that the Green Pass is no longer compulsory, but actually it would be better to still have it because there are people who have not even had one vaccination. It is not fair compared to us who have had three. The decision to lift COVID-19-related restrictions comes just weeks after Italy dropped pre-arrival testing requirements for vaccinated travellers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The measures will be welcomed by business owners and the tourist industry, which have felt the economic impact of the pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But Italy is still registering over 60,000 new infections each day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's a chance to award outstanding journalism,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: but also have a poke at the press and the U.S. president.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But Saturday's White House Correspondents' Dinner had a serious tone, with the war in Ukraine raging.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Joe Biden had a wholehearted message for journalists not only in America, but globally.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: JOE BIDEN, President of the United States, What's clear, and I mean this from the bottom of my heart, that you, the free press, matter more than you ever did in the last century.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Now, I really mean it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I've always believed that good journalism holds up a mirror to ourselves to reflect on the good, the bad, and the true.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Tonight, I want to congratulate the awardees and the scholarship winners who carry on that sacred tradition. We've all seen the courage of the Ukrainian people because of the courage of American reporters in this room and your colleagues across the world who are on the ground taking their lives in their own hands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This is the first time a commander in chief has attended a black tie event in six years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And the occasion marks Biden's first attendance as a U.S. president.

sentences.sentence: The Goodwill ambassador for the United Nations Refugee Agency met some of the displaced people there. The Hollywood actress's trip comes one month after her visit to Yemen, where she made parallels between the people suffering in both countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Could Irish nationalists achieve for the first time in the 100 years existence of Northern Ireland the premier position of power here?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's an increasingly likely prospect for Sinn Fein if the polls are to be believed in the run-up to the province's Assembly elections this Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: While the party has traditionally campaigned first and foremost on currently British Northern Ireland becoming a part of the Republic of Ireland, this time other issues are at the forefront in an attempt to appeal to left-wing voters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Our priority is, as Mary-Lou has said, is to make politics work and to show that real change is possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I think the last number of months have proven that when MLAs cooperate together across party lines in the Assembly that real delivery is very possible. Delivery of progressive change that can make that real difference to people's lives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: However the largest unionist party, the DUP, has other ideas. They've held the position of First Minister here since 2007 and are hoping that many find it difficult to vote for a party that has been historically linked with the IRA.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The DUP's leader accused their nationalist rivals of focusing solely on the goal of having a poll on the province's constitutional future, rather than ordinary bread and butter issues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Whilst we're focusing on the issues that matter to ordinary people and to families right across Northern Ireland, they're focusing on their real agenda, which is to pursue their plans for a quarter full.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In Northern Ireland, parties from both sides of the sectarian divide must join a coalition to govern. However, the DUP has said it will not enter a new power-sharing government unless the Northern Ireland protocol governing post-Brexit trade with the rest of the United Kingdom is completely overhauled, which Sinn Fein won't do.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And to make a complicated situation more difficult, this year's election is seeing the continued rise of a third choice, neither unionist nor Irish nationalist.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Parties like Alliance hope to appeal to voters whose political identity isn't crafted on whether the province should remain as part of the UK.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Polls suggest that they will gain votes and seats.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Northern Ireland has been largely at peace for 25 years, after decades of sectarian violence.
